title: Newsom Signs California Redistricting Plan to Counter Texas Republicans
summary: Gov. Gavin Newsom and Democratic state lawmakers moved quickly to create new districts that could help their party flip five congressional seats. Their plan still requires voter approval.

title: Gavin Newsom’s Redistricting Ballot Fight Raises $6.2 Million Online
summary: The figure makes plain how a gerrymandering push that began in Texas but spread nationwide has energized the Democratic base.

title: Taking on the Fed, Trump Combines Retribution Tactics With a Power Play
summary: The president’s second term has been marked by his eagerness to go after his foes and his assertions of presidential authority. Both traits are on display as he seeks control over the central bank.

title: Trump’s Attacks on Fed Overshadow a Critical Moment for the Central Bank
summary: The president’s calls for Lisa Cook, a Fed governor, to resign are diverting attention from economic issues as top central bankers from around the world gather in Jackson, Wyo.

title: Powell Is on the Cusp of Taking a Big Gamble With the U.S. Economy
summary: Jerome Powell, the Federal Reserve chair, is managing a high-stakes balancing act as he grapples with a cooling labor market, rising inflation and White House pressure to cut interest rates.

title: Noem’s Spending Rule Causes Delays at Homeland Security Dept.
summary: The secretary’s requirement that she personally approve any expense over $100,000 has created a backlog of “mission critical” contracts, records show.

title: F.B.I. Plans to Lower Recruiting Standards, Alarming Agents
summary: The plan appears to be part of a broader effort to shift the agency’s focus from tracking national security threats to fighting crime.

title: State Dept. Unlawfully Withheld Visas Under Trump’s Travel Ban, Judge Rules
summary: The ruling involved a subset of applicants who had won the right to apply for a visa under a lottery system aimed at fostering diversity.

title: NY Appeals Court Throws Out Trump’s Half-Billion-Dollar Fine in Civil Fraud Case
summary: New York appeals judges said that the judgment was excessive, but agreed to uphold the case so the appeal could continue.

title: Court Decision to Toss Penalty Frees Trump Family of Financial Straits
summary: The president’s financial situation had already improved after taking office a second time, thanks to his cryptocurrency ventures.

title: Joao Silva’s Journey Back to Afghanistan
summary: Fifteen years after a combat photographer lost his legs to a land mine, he returned to the place in Afghanistan where it happened.

title: Judge Says Habba Has Served as U.S. Attorney Without Legal Authority
summary: Defense lawyers had questioned whether Alina Habba, a Trump loyalist, was legally authorized to run the U.S. attorney’s office in New Jersey.

title: See Trump’s Deployment of the National Guard, Other Federal Agents in Washington, D.C.

title: Red Envelopes With Cash Are Changing Hands at Adams Campaign Rallies

title: Across 5 Indictments, Prosecutors Paint a Picture of a City for Sale
summary: Ingrid Lewis-Martin, the former chief adviser to Mayor Eric Adams, is accused of taking bribes in exchange for acting on behalf of favor-seekers across New York City.

title: As Adams Tries to Run on His Record, Scandals Keep Swirling Around Him
summary: Mayor Eric Adams of New York has sought to argue that his first-term wins have earned him the right to serve a second. But he cannot shake the stench of corruption around his administration.

title: Analysis: What Progress Has Trump Really Made in Ukraine Peace Talks?
summary: Nearly a week after President Trump’s Alaska summit, his suggestions of imminent breakthroughs have not come to pass.

title: Vance Recounts Telling Zelensky to ‘Behave’ in Trump Meeting
summary: It was not the first time that the vice president had addressed Ukraine’s leader with words more commonly spoken to toddlers than heads of state.

title: Hurricane Erin Is Heading Out to Sea. People Are Riveted Anyway.
summary: The Category 2 hurricane isn’t expected to make landfall. Still, it’s drawing notice as the first named storm to reach hurricane strength this year.

title: Hurricane Erin Captured From International Space Station
summary: The International Space Station captured the unusually large storm as it swirled near the East Coast of the United States.

title: Europe Watches as Hurricane Erin Crosses the Atlantic
summary: It won’t be a hurricane much longer, but the storm could still make an impact next week.

title: Heart of the Menendez Case: Who Deserves a Second Chance?

summary: The hearings are being held on consecutive days, with separate deliberations for each brother.

summary: Along with other East Coast states, Delaware is using natural materials to protect vulnerable coastal areas.

summary: Rather than conserve or build, some people just want to destroy.

summary: State Democratic officials withdrew the endorsement of a Minneapolis mayoral candidate who has drawn comparisons to Zohran Mamdani, the New York mayoral hopeful.

title: U.S. Kills Islamic State Operative in Rare Raid in Syria
summary: The Pentagon provided few details about the operation. But counterterrorism raids — as opposed to airstrikes — typically involve helicopter-borne commandos.

title: Family of Slain New Jersey Woman Who Reported Harassment Says Police ‘Failed’
summary: Dr. Lauren Semanchik told the police that she was “especially uncomfortable” because her ex-boyfriend was a state trooper. She and her boyfriend were later shot to death.
